Package ohos.miscservices.inputmethodability

Interface KeyboardDelegate


  • public interface KeyboardDelegate
    A delegate interface for soft keyboards, which is defined by the input method framework and needs to be implemented. This interface is used to process callbacks from the client.

    You should implement this interface and register the callbacks with the input method framework by calling the InputMethodAbility#onCreateKeyboardInterface() method.

    Since:
    3

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void onCursorContextChanged​(float x, float y, float height)
      Called when the cursor position changes.
      boolean onKeyDown​(KeyEvent event)
      Called when a keydown event occurs on the physical keyboard.
      boolean onKeyUp​(KeyEvent event)
      Called when a keyup event occurs on the physical keyboard.

      Called when the cursor position or the selected text changes.
      void onTextChanged​(int token, EditingText text)
      Called when the text in the component on the client changes in full-screen mode.

    • Method Detail

      • onKeyDown

        boolean onKeyDown​(KeyEvent event)
        Called when a keydown event occurs on the physical keyboard.

        This callback is used to respond to an input event of the physical keyboard.

        Parameters:
        event - Indicates a keydown event of the physical keyboard.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the input method application consumes the event and terminates event transfer; returns false if the input method application passes the event to other applications no matter whether the event is consumed.
        Since:
        3

      • onKeyUp

        boolean onKeyUp​(KeyEvent event)
        Called when a keyup event occurs on the physical keyboard.

        This callback is used to respond to an input event of the physical keyboard.

        Parameters:
        event - Indicates a keyup event of the physical keyboard.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the input method application consumes the event and terminates event transfer; returns false if the input method application passes the event to other applications no matter whether the event is consumed.
        Since:
        3

      • onSelectionChanged

        void onSelectionChanged​(int oldBegin,
                        int oldEnd,
                        int newBegin,
                        int newEnd)
        Called when the cursor position or the selected text changes. The input method application can receive the change information through this callback.

        This method is usually used in full-screen mode to receive the cursor information changed on the client.

        Parameters:
        oldBegin - Indicates the start index of the cursor before the selected text changes.
        oldEnd - Indicates the end index of the cursor before the selected text changes.
        newBegin - Indicates the start index of the cursor after the selected text changes.
        newEnd - Indicates the end index of the cursor after the selected text changes.
        Since:
        3

      • onCursorContextChanged

        void onCursorContextChanged​(float x,
                            float y,
                            float height)
        Called when the cursor position changes. The position is updated through this callback.

        This callback is used for physical keyboards. If you want to enable your application to move the candidates window with the cursor, use this callback to obtain the cursor coordinates on the screen and the cursor height.

        Parameters:
        x - Indicates the horizontal position of the cursor in the screen coordinate system.
        y - Indicates the position of the cursor bottom in the screen coordinate system.
        height - Indicates the cursor height. When the cursor locates at the bottom of the screen, you can use this parameter and y to calculate the position of cursor top and then draw the candidates window above the cursor.
        Since:
        3

      • onTextChanged

        void onTextChanged​(int token,
                   EditingText text)
        Called when the text in the component on the client changes in full-screen mode. The changed text is synchronized to the component of the input method through this callback.

        This method is usually used in full-screen mode to receive text changes on the client.

        Parameters:
        token - Indicates the ID of the session.
        text - Indicates the updated text.
        Since:
        3
